intro: Hornstedtia sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Sorsogon Valley grass, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, leaf-like blades. The plant typically grows in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to tropical climates. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
